items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message:
Tide locking where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea,  today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible today, Thursday 30 October.

We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. Neap tides with a small tidal surge mean that the low tides are not very low, restricting drainage and preventing water levels in the Broads to drop more quickly. We expect levels to start returning to normal soon.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

This message will be updated by 10:00am tomorrow, Friday 31 October 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.eaAreaName: Kent, South London and East Sussex
items.message:
High river levels today have led to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the morning of 30 October 2025 . 
Locations most affected will be low lying land around East Farleigh Lock. Flooding is not expected in Maidstone today. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 4:30PM on 30 October 2025 or as the situation changes.
